intro: Bupleurum aureum var. breviinvolucratum, commonly known as the golden bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties have made it a subject of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
